cause.description:
Finding A Cure for Epilepsy and Seizures (FACES) is a not-for-profit effort by the NYU Comprehensive Epilepsy Center to raise funds to improve the quality of life for all persons affected by epilepsy through clinical care, education, and research. The NYU Comprehensive Epilepsy Center is currently the largest program for the care of children and adults with epilepsy in the United States. It is a Level 4 Epilepsy Center, providing the most complex forms of intensive monitoring, more extensive neuropsychological and psychosocial services, and neurosurgical services for epilepsy treatment including those with intractable epilepsy.
for more information, go to:
http://www.med.nyu.edu/faces/
1. Advance the care and quality of life for all persons with epilepsy
2. Develop methods to measure quality of life in children with epilepsy
3. Study immunologic changes that may be associated with seizures
4. Study the complex fabric of social and emotional changes in all persons with epilepsy
5. Create support networks for children and their parents, including those children with unusual forms and difficult-to-treat cases of epilepsy
cause.mission: improve the quality of life for all people affected by epilepsy through research, clinical programs, education and awareness, and community building events.
cause.name: Epilepsy awareness
